title: TRANSACTIONS_66, error parsing transaction payload
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2021.12.3-beta`

OS & Version: `Linux`

#### Expected behaviour

working node

#### Actual behaviour

lots of errors, not sure how to debug (problem with erigon, network, machine itself)

#### Backtrace

````
[WARN] [12-24|11:16:42.058] [txpool.fetch] Handling incoming message msg=TRANSACTIONS_66 err="parse transaction payload: transaction must be either 1 list or 1 string"
````

#### Drive space

```
Filesystem      1K-blocks       Used  Available Use% Mounted on
udev             65883984          0   65883984   0% /dev
tmpfs            13189656       2232   13187424   1% /run
/dev/md2       2077506936 1755345204  216560352  90% /
tmpfs            65948272          0   65948272   0% /dev/shm
tmpfs                5120          0       5120   0% /run/lock
```

90% full, could it be causing problems?
I've got the same issue. About 70% of drive space is free.

“ 90% full, could it be causing problems? ”
No, fixed by https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/3156
Having the same issue in the past week or so
Seeing the same issue in the past week or so. Not sure if I should shut off the node.
Fixed in devel and stable branches
Having the same issue with 2021.12.2-beta (not 2021.12.3-beta). Can I safely ignore the warnings until a new beta version that includes the fix is released?

> Having the same issue with 2021.12.2-beta (not 2021.12.3-beta). Can I safely ignore the warnings until a new beta version that includes the fix is released?

Yes.

> Fixed in devel and stable branches

I got help from @tjayrush. All I had to do was stop the sync then git pull to re-build the node. 

(Steps for newbies like me) 
Step 1: Stop the sync (control + C, depends on your machine)
Step 2: "git pull" 
Step 3: "make all" 

It's been running smoothly since. Thank you all.

@AskAlexSharov Why do you think is the reason is for so many RLP decoding issues?  Is this something new that we are observing?  Is this some kind of spam/DoS attack to slow other nodes down to gain some advantage, or is there some bad library/client code out there that's not RLP encoding correctly?  I'm new to running an Ethereum node and just trying to learn :)
Some bad node with incorrect Eth66 support
